section.title: Music
section.para: You can add a single MP3 song or a sequence of songs (playlist) to your show. The music soundtrack plays as your photos are displayed during the show. If your show has a soundtrack, you can disable it using the Settings Tab, see for more information.

section.title: Adding Music
section.para: The Music... button and the File|Music... menu item both display the MP3 file chooser, allowing you to select MP3 music files to use as a soundtrack for your show.
The MP3 file chooser has a Listen hyperlink which will play the currently selected MP3 file using your systems media player. This can be used to preview music files as you select one.

You can only select a single file to use as the soundtrack. Each time you select a file using the MP3 file chooser, it replaces the current file with the new one. You can see the currently selected MP3 file in the tooltip displayed by hovering your mouse over the Music... button at the bottom of the main PhotoPulse window.

section.title: MP3 Playlist Editor
section.para: In addition to MP3 files, you can also choose MP3 playlist (M3U) files. An MP3 playlist is an ordered list of references to other MP3 files to play in sequence. This allows you to use multiple MP3 files for your soundtrack by building a playlist containing the MP3 files you want, and choosing the M3U playlist as the single music file for your show.

You can create your own M3U file using the MP3 Playlist Editor. Choose Build MP3 Playlist... from the Tools menu to display the editor. If your current music file is an M3U file, then the editor will load it and allow you to edit the contents. Otherwise the editor will allow you to create a playlist from scratch.
MP3 Playlist Editor
MP3 File List
Displays the MP3 files currently in your playlist. The order the files are displayed is the order they will play back. Click on a filename to select it, Ctrl-Click and Shift-Click to select multiple files at one time.
Add...
Displays the MP3 file chooser allowing you to choose MP3 files to add to the playlist. You can select multiple files at once in the file chooser by using Ctrl-Click and Shift-Click.
Remove
Removes the selected MP3 files from your playlist. This does not delete the files from your disk, it just excludes them from the playlist.
Move Up
Moves the selected MP3 files up in the playlist.
Move Down
Moves the selected MP3 files down in the playlist.
Load...
Displays an M3U file chooser, allowing you to load a new M3U playlist to edit. The current playlist will be replaced by the new one loaded.
Save...
Displays an M3U file chooser, allowing you to save the current playlist to an M3U file.
OK
Dismisses the playlist editor and makes the new M3U playlist file the new music soundtrack for your show. If you have not yet saved your playlist as an M3U file, you will first be prompted to save it.
